meanings.definition: Waterscapes: landscapes that feature bodies of water
meanings.sent1: The beautiful waterscapes in the painting included a serene lake and lush greenery.
meanings.sent2: The photographer captured the waterscapes of the ocean meeting the sky at sunset.
meanings.sent3: The ducks seemed to be discussing the best spot in the waterscapes for their afternoon swim.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a waterscapes of memories, each wave representing a different moment in time.
meanings.sent5: The waterscapes of the river sparkled like diamonds under the midday sun.

meanings.definition: Waterscapes: the overall appearance of a body of water and its surroundings
meanings.sent1: The resort was known for its stunning waterscapes, with crystal-clear pools and tropical plants.
meanings.sent2: The artist painted the waterscapes with attention to every detail of the ripples and reflections.
meanings.sent3: The picnic by the waterscapes turned into a splash-filled adventure when the dog decided to join in.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes reflected the waterscapes of the lake, mirroring the tranquility she felt within.
meanings.sent5: As the storm approached, the waterscapes of the bay transformed into a swirling mass of chaos.
